progDesc: The character is adapted to 1 environment/Rank
shortDesc: You can survive in 1 harsh environment per rank

progDesc: The character’s alternate form is built from 10 Character Points/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: A small physical change resulting in no change to abilities of any kind
A less powerful form where the transformation removes all normal stats, abilities, defects, ect and lets you rebiuld with 10 points/rank
A super powered form where the transformation keeps your normal normal stats, abilities, and stuff and lets you add more with 10 CP

shortDesc: You can transform into another form, potentially a very powerful one. Go super saiyan

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You can befriend animals with a charisma check, dm determines DC and modifiers

progDesc: All attack damage the character receives is reduced by 4 points/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: A shield, reduces damage by 4 points/rank, but only on a successful block(requires ranged defense to block ranged attacks)
Reduces damage by 4 points per rank, but does not protect a small area large enough for a called shot. Costs 4 points per rank but total cost is reduced by 2
Reduces damage by 4 points per rank, but has a small area large enough for a called shot that reduces damage by half that value. Costs 4 points per rank, but total cost is reduced by 1
Armor optimized against an uncommon particular attack

shortDesc: Armor that reduces damage by 4 points per rank, has effects that change how it works

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You can distract a group of potentially hostile individuals determined by rank or motivate a portion of a captive audience

progDesc: The character’s Base Attack Bonus is increased by 1 Point/Rank
shortDesc: base attack bonus +1/rank

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You can inspire a number of people determined by your rank

progDesc: The character can combine attacks with up to 2 other characters/Rank
shortDesc: Target has a defense penalty of -1 per character combining special attacks and total special attack damage(accross the team) is doubled, but attack uses lowest attack bonus and occurs on lowest initiative

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: access nearby computer and data technology in range with a Computer Use check

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.cusDesc: Infecting targets is difficult
Infecting targets is relatively easy, a scratch or bite might transmit it

shortDesc: You can transform people into something like yourself

progDesc: The character’s Hit Points are increased by 1d8/Rank (plus Constitution modifiers)
shortDesc: 1d8 hp/rank

progDesc: The character’s Armour Class is increased by 1/Rank
shortDesc: Danger instict!

progDesc: The player may re roll a number of dice rolls each game session equal to 1/Rank
shortDesc: reroll 1d20/day

progDesc: The duplicate is built from 10 Character Points/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: CP are distributed to form the duplicate proportiatly to how they where on your character, though they don't need the duplicate attibute
Form the duplicate however you want, you can't get anything you don't have or ranks above what you have

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: Magic

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You're elastic and can stretch yourself, and you are better at hitting and defending things

progDesc: The characters’ Energy Points are increased by 20 Points/Rank
shortDesc: Lots of energy

progDesc: One of the character’s Ability Scores is increased by 2/Rank
shortDesc: Better Stats

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.cusDesc: See page 46 for more details
See page 46

shortDesc: control the environment!

bonuses.target: cAttacDesc Exorcism:A Wis attack contested by Will save against possesed, on success possesed looses EP and target cannot attack for one round. You cannot defend when doing this attack, or make other attacks

shortDesc: You may perform an exorsism ritual as a Wis attack contested by Will save against possesed. When you succeed the target looses EP and cannot attack for one round, you cannot defend or perform other actions/attacks

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
The character gains 1 extra attack each round/Rank
shortDesc: make extra attacks at your max attack bonus

progDesc: The character gains 1 extra defence each round/Rank
shortDesc: You get extra defenses with no penalty

progDesc: The character has 1 feature/Rank
shortDesc: One useful non-combat ability/rank

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.cusDesc: Flight limited to skimming 1-2 yards above the ground
Fly like an airplane instead of a hover in air
Flyer can only become airborne if they launch from a tall place or moving thing. Can only gain speed by diving or thermals
Fly like an airplane instead of a hover in air

shortDesc: You can fly!

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.cusDesc: flunkies are not wariors. They can interpose themselves between you and them and will defend themselves, but won't attack
flunkies will take up arms for you

shortDesc: You have flunkies determined by rank, they are NPCs built from 20 cp and 4*(2+int) SP, and they are all identical

progDesc: The Force Field reduces damage by 10 Points/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: a shield or wall of force that is 10x10 feet big
a force field that protects you and only you
a force field that extends past you, allowing it to protect others nearby(default is a sphere around you 25% bigger than your longest dimension)

shortDesc: Force Field protects you from damage, if the damage is greater than what would be protected it temporarily looses 1 rank of protection, regenerates when off by 1 rank per turn

progDesc: The character can restore up to 10 Hit Points/Rank to a target
shortDesc: You can as many people as you want 10 hp/rank/day. See pg 49 for more info

progDesc: Gain +2 bonus/rank to specific Ability/Skill checks
The character gains one heightened sense or technique/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: Have better normal senses
Sense things humans can't

shortDesc: Your senses are just better

progDesc: The character gains an additional 4 Skill Points/Rank
shortDesc: More SP!

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: Fly through the vacuum of space(but not through atmosphere) faster than light. GM determines progression

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.choicePrompt: What are you going to be immune to? This should play a small role in the game
progressions.shortDesc: The immunity plays a small role in the game. The attack form is rare or requires very limiting specific conditions for immunity to work

progressions.choicePrompt: What are you going to be immune to? This should play a moderate role in the game
progressions.shortDesc: The immunity plays a moderate role in the game. The attack form is uncommon or requires specific semi-broad conditions for immunity to work

progressions.choicePrompt: What are you going to be immune to? This should play a large role in the game
progressions.shortDesc: The immunity plays a large role in the game. For example, you may be immune to electricity or a specific weapon type like rapiers

progressions.choicePrompt: What are you going to be immune to? This should play a major role in the game
progressions.shortDesc: The immunity plays a major role in the game. For example, fire/heat or a broad weapon type such as sword

progressions.choicePrompt: What are you going to be immune to? This should play an extreme role in the game
progressions.shortDesc: The immunity plays an extreme role in the game. Usually extremly broad, like gunfire or bladed attacks

progressions.choicePrompt: What are you going to be immune to? This should play a primal role in the game
progressions.shortDesc: The immunity plays a primal role in the game. This would be something like weapons, energy, or blunt trauma(think immunity to nonmagical bludgeoning,piercing,slashing)

shortDesc: You are not effected in any way by a specific thing

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You can pass through materials. If something isn't on the list, use what it most closely resembles(so Humans would be rank 2 because they are mostly water)

progDesc: The character is invisible to one sense or technique/Rank
shortDesc: The character is completely indetectible by some human sense or other technique, attacks against them using that sense suffer a penalty(-4 for melee or -8 for range). They still leave evidence of their existance as normal.

progDesc: The item is built using 5 Character Points/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: The item is easier to take or loose, say a thrown thing or a vehicle
The item is hard to take or loose, say a locket that is almost always on you

shortDesc: A powerful item!

progDesc: The character adds 20 to his or her Jump Skill each Rank
shortDesc: You jump real good

progDesc: The character receives 10 Magic Points/Rank to acquire magical powers
shortDesc: Magic(It's complicated)

progDesc: Damage the character delivers is increased by 2 Points.

progressions.cusDesc: A single attack receives +2 damage/rank
All attacks get +2 damage/rank

shortDesc: You do more damage per attack for some reason

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You can build and repair at supernatural speeds determined by your rank

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You can force someone to transform if they fail a DC 14+rank fort save. The transformation is worth 1 cp or 3 defect points/rank, usually restricted to physical attributes/defects

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

descProgDetails: mimic up to rank 1 attributes/rank 2 skills from 15 feet away for 5 rounds
mimic up to rank 2 attributes/rank 4 skills from 30 feet for 1 min
mimic up to rank 3 attributes/rank 6 skills from 45ft for 2min
mimic up to rank 4 attributes/rank 8 skills from 60ft for 4 minutes
mimic up to rank 5 attributes/rank 8 skills from 75 ft for 8 minutes
mimic up to rank 6 attributes/rank 12 skills from 90 feet for 16 min
progressions.cusDesc: you can mimic one attribute at a time

descProgDetails: mimic up to rank 1 attributes/rank 2 skills from 15 feet away for 5 rounds
mimic up to rank 2 attributes/rank 4 skills from 30 feet for 1 min
mimic up to rank 3 attributes/rank 6 skills from 45ft for 2min
mimic up to rank 4 attributes/rank 8 skills from 60ft for 4 minutes
mimic up to rank 5 attributes/rank 8 skills from 75 ft for 8 minutes
mimic up to rank 6 attributes/rank 12 skills from 90 feet for 16 min
progressions.cusDesc: you can mimic as many attributes as you want a time, each is a seperate check

shortDesc: You copy the effects of an attribute rank less than your mimic rank or skill rank less than twice your mimic rank for a limited time, relying on your power Usage(mimic) skill

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.cusDesc: You can control a very specific group of people like family members or members of a specific unit
You can control a somewhat specific group of people like shinto priests
You can control a broad group of humans like Japanese people
You can control anyone

shortDesc: You can mind control people(number and durration depending on rank) by making a power usage(Mind control) check with DC 10 plus target's intelligence modifier and them failing a Will save against DC 10 plus your wisdom plus your rank in power usage(mind control)

progDesc: The character gains a +2/Rank for Willpower saves involving mind invasion
shortDesc: You are protected against mind invasion(mind control, mind combat,ect)

progDesc: The character gains 1 Natural Weapon/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: Sharp talons on your extreminities dealing 1d4 damage on unarmed attacks(strikes)
Sharp teath, mandibles, or a beak that does +2 damage. You can use it to grapple dealing the same damage each round but getting a -4 penalty to defense
Stabby horns do 2 extra damage(strikes) or if you beat the target in initiative an extra 1d6 instead but if you miss you get -4 to initiative and -2 AC
Anyone grappling you recieves 2 extra damage per round due to your spines
Spiky tail that does 2 extra damage. Target must make a dex check to remain balanced or gets -4 to initiative
Tentacles that give you a +2 bonus to grappling and defending against grapples and opponent suffers -1 AC penalty against them

shortDesc: You have 1 natural weapon/rank

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

descProgDetails: can occasionally rely on org for suport/favors for the same in return
Character has respected status in the org, you have some status and wealth
Character has middle rank like a president of a department
Character has senior rank right bellow the top
Character has controlling rank in several orgs(ruler of a small nation)
progressions.cusDesc: Orginization has moderate power

descProgDetails: can occasionally rely on org for suport/favors for the same in return
Character has respected status in the org, you have some status and wealth
Character has middle rank like a president of a department
Character has senior rank right bellow the top
Character has controlling rank in several orgs(ruler of a small nation)
progressions.cusDesc: Orginization has significant power

descProgDetails: can occasionally rely on org for suport/favors for the same in return
Character has respected status in the org, you have some status and wealth
Character has middle rank like a president of a department
Character has senior rank right bellow the top
Character has controlling rank in several orgs(ruler of a small nation)
progressions.cusDesc: Orginization has great power

shortDesc: You are associated with an orginization of your choice!

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You own a big mecha. It can be modified by attributes and defects at half cost/bonus with gm permision

progDesc: The character gains 1 major and 4 minor items of Personal Gear/Rank
shortDesc: You own or have easy consistent access to minor and major items that are not mundane(A knife is mundane, a full toolbox is minor, a car is major) determined by your rank. See page 57 for more info

progDesc: The character owns one or more pet monsters, constructed from 20 Character Points plus 20/Rank
shortDesc: You have 1 or more pet monsters made of 20 cp as a lvl 1 adventurer and +20 cp to split between them each rank

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

descProgDetails: size of a small rug, provides 10 ep
size of a small room, provides 20 ep
size of a large room, provides 30 ep
size of a house, provides 40 ep
size of a city block, provides 50ep
size of several city blocks, provides 60ep

shortDesc: You have access to a place of power that has EP you can use as your own, they regenerate over 10 hours from empty

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

descProgDetails: cize of an entire city(or bigger)
progressions.cusDesc: The portal to the pocket dimension is a fixed location. Can only exit the way you entered

descProgDetails: cize of an entire city(or bigger)
progressions.cusDesc: The portal to the pocket dimension is fixed on something that can move, like a door inside a vehicle or a single item. Can only exit the way you entered

descProgDetails: cize of an entire city(or bigger)
progressions.cusDesc: The character can enter the pocket dimension through a particular class of objects like mirrors or pools of water. The character can exit through the same class within [rank] miles of the enterance.

shortDesc: You have the power to access a pocket dimension you control through 1 portal at a time. You can have another for 1 point of cost/rank

progDesc: The character reduces the DC of saving throws related to the defensive use of an Attribute by 1/Rank

bonuses.text: Use choice1 to defend against attack

shortDesc: You can use an attribute to defend, blocking all damage when you succeed a save against the toHit of the attack once per round

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

descProgDetails: illusions size of a room or large object
illusions size of a neighboorhood(few hundred square yards)
progressions.cusDesc: Your projection is detectable by 1 sense, usually sight. This sense is choosen on character creation

descProgDetails: illusions size of a room or large object
illusions size of a neighboorhood(few hundred square yards)
progressions.cusDesc: Your projection is detectable by 2 senses, usually sight and hearing. These senses are choosen on character creation

descProgDetails: illusions size of a room or large object
illusions size of a neighboorhood(few hundred square yards)
progressions.cusDesc: Your projection is detectable by 3 senses. These senses are choosen on character creation

descProgDetails: illusions size of a room or large object
illusions size of a neighboorhood(few hundred square yards)
progressions.cusDesc: Your projection is detectable by all senses
1 more projection/rank

shortDesc: You create a projection/illusion. Usually this illusion is still unless attached to a moving object or the projection is concentrated on. The illusion cannot do damage or harm of any kind, and close physical inspection. Normally only one projection can be maintained at a time, but you can get more with 1cp/projection

progDesc: The character can regenerate 1 Hit Point each round/Rank
shortDesc: The character heals 1hp/round/rank if they are concious or unconcious. At rank 3 they can recover from clinical death(heart stopped) but non-brain dead and at rank 6 the regeneration will regenerate massive damage like lost limbs/organs or being cut into pieces, though getting yourself blown to bits will still kill you

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.cusDesc: The Reincarnation is easy to stop
The Reincarnation is hard to stop

shortDesc: You will slowly reincarnate into a similar form at 1 hp unless this is stopped by some means, for example being exploded(easy) or a specific ritual unkown to most(hard)

progDesc: Under specific conditions, the character instantly regain 5 Hit Points or Energy Points/Rank
shortDesc: Under specific conditions you can regenerate 5 hp/rank, requiring 1 round of only dodging or avoid attacks

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
shortDesc: You can partially block 1 sense per rank, giving a penalty of -4 to checks relating to those senses

progDesc: The servant is constructed from 10 Character Points plus 10/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: The servant is a particular person who can't be replaced
The servant can be replaced with some sort of ritual

shortDesc: Servant is made of 10 cp +10cp/level and starts as a lvl 1 adventurer(but with 10 cp instead of 40)

progDesc: The character gains 1 Sixth Sense/Rank
short: The character can sense one thing that isn't normally detectable(such as astral beings, danger, mental angish)

progDesc: Descriptive; see below

progressions.cusDesc: You can shrink and grow back, but cannot exceed your normal size
You can grow and shrink back, but cannot shrink bellow your normal size
You can shrink or grow as you want

shortDesc: Over a round you can grow/shrink depending on your rank. For example, someone with rank 2 shrink only size change could become 1/2 their size and return

progDesc: The character possesses an attack that delivers 1d8 damage/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: A secondary attack that only can exist with a primary special attack of higher rank
A primary attack

shortDesc: a special/non standard attack that does 1d8 damage per rank and can spend those dice for abilities or get them from defencts

progDesc: The character gains 1 Special Defence slot/Rank
shortDesc: You are more resistant or immune to specific kinds of damage/attacks

progDesc: The character gains 1 type of movement/Rank

progressions.cusDesc: Takes half fall damage
With a DC 10 Wis check you can hop between your home dimension to one other specified dimension choosen at character creation(with GM permission)
Move at full speed over sand, snow, and ice
You can slither on the ground at full speed(it's stealthy)
You can swing through forest/city or any area with frequent structures above your height
You don't leave footprints, tracks, or a scent when you walk or run
You can swing through forest/city or any area with frequent structures above your height
Move at regular speed by bouncing between vertical serfaces!
Cling to walls or cielings as though they where the floor!
Walk or run accross the water as though it where land!
By attuning yourself to the natural world you can tell the "right" way to go, but it may not take you where you want to go

shortDesc: You can move in special ways

progDesc: Descriptive; see below
